summary: Barbara L. Mosley was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list her name, position, and salary details during her employment with the committee. The documents provide a timeline of her employment with the HSCA, indicating she was on staff for at least a year.
significance: Barbara L. Mosley's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll and certification reports indicates she contributed to the committee's operations during its investigation.
